name: billyamericana
text: Cute.

name: suprememongoose
text: "Mars Bars in Batter". This is mindboggling, yet fantastic. It also sounds...deadly, much in the same way as Deep Fried Cheesecake on a Stick.

name: mortshire
text:
truly you have never known the horrors of the "scotch egg":
[IMGS OFF]

name: laikalost
text: That looks delish!

name: baryonyx
text: At first glance I thought that was an octopus dipped in a blender.

name: wite_rabit
text: SCOTCH EGG IS THE WONDER FOOD. ALL HAIL THE SCOTCH EGG!

name: soticoto
text:
HERESY!
Nobody speaks that way about Cheesecake and avoids the impending divine wrath!

name: heccibiggs
text:
They used to sell them in my school (I'm from Greater London but we still got them for some reason), and while I was so, SO intrigued, I never tried one...

...because I was afraid I might like it.

name: hellofditties
text:
The very same reason why I haven't tried one.

That, and I'm afraid I might be violently ill.

name: mashisoyo
text: Woah, woah, woah. Deep fried Mars Bars are incredibly delicious. The only thing that ruins the experience is knowing that you're shortening your life by several weeks just by touching the thing.

name: rykan
text:
It is actually made of awesome.
The batter tastes like doughnuts, and the chocolate goes all melty and nice.

name: senseihollywood
text: those Scots are some real health nuts...

name: honesttom
text: I remember someone, I forget who, said that most Scottish food was invented on a dare. Some highlights I came across in Edinburgh include Mars Bars in batter, pizza in batter, muffins topped with chocolate and Mars Bars and a sandwich consisting of a Terry's Chocolate Cream between two slices of buttered bread. I get the sense they invented Scotch, then got wasted and invented most of their cuisine.

name: ninjaein
text: So, the entirety of Scottish cuisine includes haggis and all sorts of food covered in batter?

name: hereward
text: They got to keep warm somehow! Scotland is terrifyingly far north.

name: dj_insomniac
text: That would be Mike Myers as Charlie MacKenzie, in "So I Married An Axe Murderer".

name: andyfaewatford
text:
Scotland played Italy in the Euro qualifiers recently (I'm talking football here), and the Scottish fans' chant went a little something like this:

Deep fry your pizzas!
We're gonnae deep fry your pizzas!
Deep fry your piiizzzzaaas!
We're gonnae deep fry your piiizzzz-as!

Which says it all really...

name: aliiis
text:
That's awesome. I actually live in Edinburgh. I bought a slice of deep fried pizza on accident on one of my first ever nights out here. Deep fried pizza is an extremely, inconceivably wrong thing. I threw it away.

My brother ate a deep fried Mars bar just the other day, though!

name: andyfaewatford
text: By accident is the only way to buy a deep fried pizza

name: i_love_kate
text: Guys, look! I just ate half of this deep fried pizza... completely on accident!

name: straw
text: A 4 for the Scotch Whiskey Heritage center.  That place is a trip.

name: aperson
text: This brings to my mind a thought: people would buy small achewood character dolls.

name: aelindil
text: OH GOD I HOPE SO

name: plusigot125
text: I would totally buy an achewood doll! They should put them in happy meals or something.

name: erinye
text: Yeah, but then you'd have to buy the food .

name: riazm
text: Come on Chris, you know that tomorow you wind up back at the Scotch Whisky Heritage Centre.

name: clever-nickname
text: I swear to god , I have a stuffed otter like that.

name: lauralou
text:
Battered mars bars are wonderful!!!
You must try them, but beware not to eat more than one or you WILL vomit!

name: charchar
text: I had half a deep-fried Snickers at the carnival, and I did vomit.  That might have something more to do with the whirlwind trip on the Spider shortly afterwards. It is a mystery.

name: honesttom
text: I was once where Philippe is. I was dressed in bandages, attacking Vanessa Feltz because I thought it would be funny.

name: jeet
text: I have a feeling that the bar Phillipe is sitting on will not be sat on for much longer.

name: laikalost
text:
Phillipe has encouraged me to purchase an equally-adorable stuffed otter for myself.

I am 21 years, and I have a stuffed otter on my bed. This drives the ladies wild.

name: greenkoolayd
text:
even better? i have a beanie baby...

[IMGS OFF]

name: cinderfella
text: Royal milf? I lived in Scotland and totally missed that... dang!

name: bourbonsamurai
text:
That's the Royal Mile, dude.
Although I imagine the royal milf might visit there at some point.

name: mshendry
text: I'm Scottish and even I don't like the food over there

name: sp1derbaby
text: Your avatar wisely agrees.

name: crankheart
text: a 4 simply because someone was telling me how fried chocolate bars are hot in scotland...and now i have ottery proof. i also find it hilarious that i live in the DEEP south, and had never heard of this particular fried atrocity.

name: retardedgenius
text:
HEY! I freakin'... LIVE here.

5.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
It is worth noting that Mars Bars in the UK are not the old Mars Bars we used to get in the States. I believe the latter had almonds in them, among other differences (and I believe they stopped making them ages ago).

It's been a long time since I had one, but I believe Mars Bars in the UK are basically what we call Milky Ways in the US.

Why do we name so much candy after celestial objects?

name: aliiis
text: Whoa whoa whoa! You call Mars bars Milky Ways?? But then what do you call Milky Ways ? Because we have them, but they are like, very very light, fluffy vanilla flavoured... I dunno... whipped... nougat-like stuff... covered in milk chocolate.

name: fineoakstructure
text: That's right, it's all flooding back now.  Milky Ways in the UK are Three Musketeers over here.  We need a flow chart.

name: heccibiggs
text: What the FUCK. Why can't you just call things by their right names.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
HEY we saved your ASS in WWII and stopped the Norman Invasion of Plymouth Rock by killing the Pope of England back in 1812 for our right to name our treats whatever the HELL we want.

We celebrate this right every day ("Guy Fawkes Day") and that is why we are proud and fat as a nation.

name: tekende
text: I'm pretty sure these candy bars are all American products, in which case it is YOU who calls them by the wrong names. SO THERE

name: heccibiggs
text: Um, I think you'll find that we invented language.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
You guys keep this up and soticoto might show up.

Don't let that happen.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Oh fuck you're right. I feel like I've started some kind of demonic summoning spell, and now I can't undo it.

We were fools, and now we'll pay the price!

name: echidnaboy
text: [soticoto]It's called Marathon, not Snickers! All Yanks are cvnts! The cake is a lie![/soticoto]

name: irondave
text: Well, the answer is that the name of the family is "Mars".  So naming their tasty snacks after spacey things just seems natural.  What I never knew is that they came from Minnesota, like me.

name: cespinarve
text: Anyone else first read that sign as "Royal Milf"?

name: theplaidknight
text: Someone did indeed

name: mal3
text:
I...I want to go to the Scotch Heritage center.

It is like...the alcoholic's mecca!
